div.div: @Kallitho Die Frage ist ein bisschen, was könnte ein Plugin "uns" helfen? Ziel ist ja, dass HomematicIP in HomeAssistant nutzbar ist und nicht anders herum. Also was wäre dein Anwendungsfall? Die Connect-API spec erlaubt so wie ich es verstehe, vollständigen zugriff auf das Homematic IP System (durch die HCU). Sollte also eine volle Integration ermöglichen, oder verstehe ich da etwas falsch? Auszug aus 3.3. Control and monitor : To control the Homematic IP system, your plugin has to do the following: Send an HmipSystemRequest with any suitable path, e.g. /hmip/device/control/setSwitchState to turn a Homematic IP switching device on or off Handle the corresponding HmipSystemResponse to evaluate whether the request was successful To also monitor the Homematic IP system state, e.g. to stay posted on the switch state of the Homematic IP switching device, your plugin further has to do the following: Register for Homematic IP system events on establishing the WebSocket connection by including the hmip-system-events header Upon startup, send an HmipSystemRequest with the path /hmip/home/getSystemState and cache the system state contained in the corresponding HmipSystemResponse Handle any incoming HmipSystemEvent by replacing cached system parts with the updated parts contained in the event Hier wird, denke ich eine von Grund auf neu gebaute Integration notwendig sein. Verstehe natürlich, dass das ein großer Aufwand ist.

Merge pull request #629 from Freika/chore/various-fixes-1
Various fixes #1
Make sure cache jobs are run only on server start
Fix inconsistent password for the `dawarich_db` service in `docker-compose_mounted_volumes.yml`.

Merge pull request #628 from Freika/feature/geoapify-reverse-geocoding
Implement support for Geoapify as reverse geocoding service
Remove Photon API env vars and use DawarichSettings for reverse geocoding settings
Fix Photon API for patreon supporters
Add notification about Photon API being under heavy load
Revert "Imported points will now be reverse geocoded only after import is finished."

Merge pull request #603 from Freika/dependabot/bundler/rubocop-rails-2.28.0
Bump rubocop-rails from 2.27.0 to 2.28.0

Merge pull request #602 from Freika/dependabot/bundler/oj-3.16.9
Bump oj from 3.16.8 to 3.16.9

Merge pull request #601 from Freika/dependabot/bundler/tailwindcss-rails-3.1.0
Bump tailwindcss-rails from 3.0.0 to 3.1.0

Bump rubocop-rails from 2.27.0 to 2.28.0
Bumps [rubocop-rails](https://github.com/rubocop/rubocop-rails) from 2.27.0 to 2.28.0. - [Release notes](https://github.com/rubocop/rubocop-rails/releases) - [Changelog](https://github.com/rubocop/rubocop-rails/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md) - [Commits](https://github.com/rubocop/rubocop-rails/compare/v2.27.0...v2.28.0)
--- updated-dependencies: - dependency-name: rubocop-rails dependency-type: direct:development update-type: version-update:semver-minor ...
Signed-off-by: dependabot[bot] <support@github.com>

Add database constraints for users table
